brooklyn.location.basic
[Java] Class MultiLocation

java.lang.Object
  brooklyn.location.basic.AbstractLocation
      brooklyn.location.basic.MultiLocation
All Implemented Interfaces:
MachineProvisioningLocation
public class MultiLocation
extends AbstractLocation

A location which consists of multiple locations stitched together to form availability zones. The first location will be used by default, but if an AvailabilityZoneExtension-aware entity is used, it may stripe across each of the locations. See notes at AvailabilityZoneExtension.

obtain

@SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
@Override
public java.lang.Object obtain(java.util.Map flags)
finds (creates) and returns a MachineLocation; this always tries the first sub-location, moving on the second and subsequent if the first throws NoMachinesAvailableException. (if you want striping across locations, see notes in AvailabilityZoneExtension.)
